dialogue.text: Come to think of it, I haven’t really spoken to Chinami over the phone yet.
It would probably brighten her day to hear from someone, so maybe I’ll do that?
Plus, it’s not like I have any qualms spending my free time chatting with a complete angel.
The only issue is whether or not she’s even awake yet.
But, oh well. Won’t hurt to try I guess.
I tap on Chinami’s name and wait to see if she answers.
Hello? Sensei?
Oh, uhh. Hey.
Why are you calling Chinami so early in the morning?
In fact, why are you calling Chinami at all?...
Oh, you know. I just thought she’d be happy to actually get a call from someone...
I can’t imagine she’s gotten to use her phone for its intended purpose yet so...Yeah.
It’s like 9:00 AM...It really couldn’t wait until later?
I’m a busy guy, Chika.
Well...I guess that’s true.
Chinami’s actually sleeping right now, but I’m really glad you called. I was actually just about to text you.
Really? For what?
Well, Yumi was supposed to come over to watch her this morning since I have work, but she just told me that she’s not feeling well and doesn’t want to get Chinami sick.
Soooo...I’m guessing you already know what I’m going to ask, right?
Right. You want me to dog-sit again.
Hahahah~ Well she won’t be wearing her mask today, so it’s just normal Chinami-sitting.
I know you said you’re busy, but I’ll be eternally grateful if you could at least hang out here for a few hours so she doesn't wake up alone.
Well...It’s not like I had anything else going on this morning.
Chika’s place is pretty far, but I guess I can probably make it there in around half an hour.
Yeah...I’ll head over now. You owe me, though.
Heheh~ Of course I do. I won’t forget this. Promise.
Chika hangs up the phone and, after getting dressed, I begin to head over...
Hey~ Thank you so so so so much. Really.
Don’t mention it. I’m free until the afternoon anyway.
That’s totally fine. Like I’ve said before, she’s fine alone. I just feel bad leaving her that way.
Is she still asleep?
Nah, she’s just sitting in front of the TV right now. I made breakfast before you got here, so you like, literally don’t need to do anything.
I love clowns.
Yeah, I think you made that pretty clear recently.
But yeah, just hang out here and do whatever for a few hours. You can leave whenever you want.
When will you be back exactly?
Not until later tonight, so don’t worry about staying the whole time.
You should know my schedule by now, Sensei. I’m at the mall every weekend.
Well hurry up and get going then. I’ll be fine here.
Yeah, yeah. I’m going.
Thanks again, though. Really.
You’ve been doing way too much for me lately. I have no idea how I’m going to repay you.
Figure that out later. Just go to work for now.
Roger that.
Chinami! Don’t annoy Sensei while I’m gone!
Chinami will do her best!
Have a nice day at work!
Chika exits the apartment, locking the door behind her and leaving me alone with her little sister.
Hello! Welcome to Chinami’s house!
Did you wash your hands?
Yeah, your sister made me wash them as soon as I came in.
Because she doesn’t want Chinami to get sick.
I don’t want Chinami to get sick either.
That’s good.
It sure is.
Now what?
What do you mean now what?
Are you just going to sit there and stare at Chinami until her sister comes home?
I...I haven’t really thought of that.
Now that she mentions it, I have absolutely no idea what I’m even supposed to be doing right now.
I am so lost and scared.
You can stare at Chinami if you want. But she’s going to watch TV if that’s okay with you.
Nothing’s even playing on the TV.
Big sis says that the TV won’t come back on until tomorrow, so Chinami is pretending that her favorite show is on instead.
And what exactly is Chinami’s favorite show?
Knowing her, I’m assuming it’s some early morning cartoon or-
Game of Thrones.
I know I’m not the one who’s supposed to be raising you, but aren’t you a little too [young]for that?
Chinami is a 5,000 year old-
Wizard. I know. Does your sister know you watch it, though?
Mhm! We watch it together on her laptop whenever she brings it home.
I can’t say I know much about this show...but from what I understand, it can get pretty gruesome and...
Well, let’s just say I was unaware that Chinami had been exposed to those kinds of things yet.
So, you’re just sitting on a cushion pretending you’re watching Game of Thrones.
Right. Chinami took a quiz on her phone that says she’s part of House Lannister.
I have no idea what that means. What does that house do?
They have a lot of money and like each other more than they’re supposed to I think.
Having a lot of money is pretty much the exact opposite of you. You don’t have {i}any{/i} money, Chinami.
This is the sad truth.
But that’s okay. Because one day, Chinami is going to be rich.
And then she's going to buy a big house for her and big sis.
And you’ll get one too since you bought Chinami her first phone.
Well thank you. But I already have a house.
That’s okay. You can have two houses. A Lannister always pays her debts.
I’m assuming that’s a quote from the show, so I’m just going to say thanks.
You’re welcome!
Now, watch pretend-TV with me while we wait for big sis to finish working.
That’s going to be hours from now. We’re really going to stare at a blank TV the entire time?
It’s not blank! There are dragons and zombie things and a few really funny looking old people.
You’re not supposed to make fun of old people, Chinami.
Shh! This is the best part!
Chinami ‘shushes’ me and I direct my attention (For reasons I don’t understand) to a blank TV screen.
This isn’t as fun as Chinami expected.
I can’t say I was really expecting any more from this.
Now what do we do?
I don’t know. It’s your house. You figure something out.
Wanna watch Chinami kill pigs? She’s really good at it.
I’m a little worried about your enthusiasm for killing animals. You know there are other games you can play on your phone, right?
Other games?
Yeah. Like, that one where you crush candy. Or that one with the farm.
Can Chinami destroy the animals on the farm?
That’s...not really the point of the game, but probably? I don’t really know.
You don’t seem to know as much as big sis when it comes to phones, Mr. Sensei.
Just Sensei is fine, Chinami.
Okay, Just Sensei.
You did that on purpose, didn’t you?
Chinami has no idea what you’re talking about. She’s just a little girl who is also an ancient wizard.
I’m beginning to think you might be smarter than you let on, Chinami...
Chinami is very confused right now.
{i}Sure she is...{/i}
Are you and big sis getting married yet?
This again? How does this keep coming up?
How many times do the two of us need to tell you that things aren’t like that between us?
A few more, probably. Chinami’s memory isn’t very good.
But she thinks you should get married anyway.
If Sensei and big sis get married, Chinami will be alone less.
Is that why you want us to get married? So I’ll come around more?
Maybe.
You know I can just, come around more {i}without{/i} marrying her, right?
You dare defy me, mere mortal?
Excuse me?
I have lived for thousands of years and you will tell me what I demand you to tell me.
Chinami, no.
Teach Chinami the secrets of life! What it means to be human!
Only then will Chinami spare you destruction!
Okay, Chinami. I will do just that.
Hooray! Chinami will learn a new thing soon! And no thanks to her future daddy!
Marrying your sister wouldn’t even make me your daddy. I’d have to marry your mom.
Hi, Mom. Can you do me a favor?
Things suddenly become incredibly morbid and don’t mesh well with the background music. Such is life.
Can you marry Sensei? He is a nice man and he bought Chinami a phone.
Chinami wants to take care of a sister the way big sis takes care of Chinami.
Also Sensei has glasses and big sis says you always liked boys with glasses.
Chinami...
Shh...I’m talking to my mom. Watch pretend-TV, Sensei.
...Fine.
I pretend to watch pretend-TV and fall into pretend-inception.
How did a trip to hang out with my student’s little sister turn into something so complicated?
{i}Also, he has lots of money. He even paid for Yumi’s phone. I think he works for the government.{/i}
Chinami, what in the world are you whispering about over there? I think I just heard something about the government.
No words, Sensei. Chinami needs silence to reach her mom through the picture.
...Whatever Chinami needs.
Chinami spends the next twenty minutes whispering to the picture of her mother while I sit next to her, pretending to not hear what she’s saying.
{i}The next few hours pass by without becoming any more comfortable.{/i}
{i}But at least Chinami didn’t spend the day alone.{/i}
{i}Chinami’s affection has increased to [chinami_love]!{/i}
